section.para: In an international trade transaction, you can use this (FT) module to request a fund transfer, for which the bank (called the Ordering Bank) can subsequently send an acknowledgement upon successful completion.

section.title: Overview
section.para: The module is a simple Cash Management feature. It enables you, on behalf of your company (the applicant) to do two types of transfer: Internal, which you use to transfer funds between two accounts both belonging to your company, and Outgoing, which you use when an external beneficiary is the recipient of the transfer, possibly with another banking institution acting as an intermediary. An outgoing transfer is also called a third-party transfer.

section.title: Functions
section.para: The menu for this module has the following groups of functions.

However, the module is associated with a single event (the submission of the transfer request and the bank's reply), and therefore there are no functions to send amendments or free-format messages to the bank.

listitem.para: Create and submit a fund transfer request.
View all existing FT Initiations that are not yet complete or have not been submitted.
Search for existing FTs based on specific search criteria.
Maintain Unsigned, Purged and Rejected FTs.

section.title: FT Initiation
section.para: This section describes the Fund Transfer Initiation function and the forms it uses.

section.title: FT Initiation Functions
section.para: This part of the menu contains several functions, providing different ways to request a Fund Transfer.

section.title: Internal
section.para: Create a Fund Transfer request for a transfer between two accounts both belonging to your company and both at the same bank.
This function displays a blank form. The electronic form asks for limited information such as the ordering and beneficiary accounts, and the currency and amount of the transfer.

section.title: Outgoing
section.para: Create a Fund Transfer request for a transfer from an accounts belonging to your company to an external beneficiary.

This function displays a blank form. It is similar to the form for an internal transfer, but contains additional input fields such as details of the beneficiary, the currency of the beneficiary's account, and the financial institution holding the account.

section.title: From Template
section.para: Create a Fund Transfer request or template from a template that you have previously created.
Most of the information for the transaction is defaulted except key data such as the expiry date or the currency and amount of the new Fund Transfer.
This function displays a list of your existing Fund Transfer templates. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Reference and/or Description fields at the top of the page.

The columns show the Reference and Description of each template. You can modify the description of a template by clicking the Edit
icon, or delete a template by clicking the Delete
icon.

Click in the Reference column to open a new Fund Transfer form, populated with the details from the selected template. After completing the form you can save it as either a new Fund Transfer or a new template.

section.title: Edit Transactions
section.para: Review, complete and submit records that a user has already created and saved, but not submitted.

When this option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Trade services > Funds Transfer page, it allows a Fund Transfer request that a user has already started and saved, to be completed. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
Click on the System ID column of the required entry to open it for further editing.

section.title: Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: Review and submit records that a user has, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

When selected, this option will present a list of Fund Transfer requests that have been prepared and saved by users in the bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click on the System ID column of the required entry to open it in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission. When clicked, the Users icon will display the user that created the transaction, and any users that have edited, authorised or verified it.

If there is sufficient authorisation in the users profile, multiple records can be submitted in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which when selected is ticked. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Operations
section.para: The operations that you can perform from the Fund Transfer initiation pages are listed below. For each of them, a popup window asks you to confirm your choice.

entry.para: Operation
Description

Save the transaction details as a draft. The Fund Transfer request remains as a pending record without being sent to the Ordering Bank for now. No validation of the mandatory fields is performed at this stage.
Send the Fund Transfer request to the Ordering Bank. Do this when all the requested (and mandatory) transaction details have been entered and the resulting record is ready for submission.

Depending on your jurisdiction profile (in particular, the amount you are authorised to validate without an additional signature), the application is either sent to the bank's Trade Services back office or remains in the client workspace as unsigned.
This action is available in non-editable mode only (review of an unsigned record). Open a new popup window with the details of the unsigned record, providing a simple way to print its content.

Save the transaction details entered as a template. The name for the template is given in the Template Id field, which is therefore mandatory. If an existing template already has this name, it is overwritten by the new one.
Leave the current page and return to the Fund Transfer main menu.
Open a popup window displaying the online help pages.

section.title: Pending FTs
section.para: This function will display a list of all Fund Transfer (FT) records that have not been approved by the bank and the ones that are in draft state.

section.title: Pending FTs - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Pending FTs function, from the tool bar, select Trade Services > Fund Transfers. Then select Pending FTs from the left side navigation menu.

section.title: Pending Fund Transfer Transactions
section.para: To use the Pending Fund Transfer function, after selecting Trade Services > Fund Transfers from the toolbar, click on Pending FTs on the left side navigation menu. These Fund Transfer transactions can be edited or submitted as required by any user with the appropriate authorities.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are System ID, Entity/Applicant Name, Beneficiary Name or Ccy fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The columns returned in the list of Fund Transfer records are the following:

section.para: This function will display a list of all FT records in the system. These can be edited or submitted as required by any user with the appropriate authorities.

important.para: Any further amendment to the FT, regardless of Approved or Rejected from the BO/MO, can be tracked though FT Inquiry option.

section.title: Maintenance
section.para: This function is user to maintain Funds Transfer records that were created, but are no longer required in the system.

section.title: Maintenance - Set Entity
section.para: List all FTs and associate an Entity. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click Set Entity and then select System ID. You can now set an entity for the FT by clicking the search icon
from the Entity field. Click the Submit button to complete the changes.

section.title: Maintenance - Set Reference
section.para: Assign a customer reference to a FT record that currently has none.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that have no reference assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form where you can assign a reference to the record.

note.para: This action is not validated against the Jurisdiction matrix. All transactions of the current files are updated.

section.title: Maintenance - Action Required
section.para: List all FTs which require an action by customers. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
Click System ID to open and create a free format FT message for the action required.

section.title: Maintenance - Unsigned FTs
section.para: List and optionally delete unsigned (unauthorised) FT transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that are unsigned (unauthorised). You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: Maintenance - Purged FTs
section.para: List and optionally delete FT transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: Maintenance - Rejected FTs
section.para: List and optionally delete Rejected transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of FT records that were submitted, but rejected by the bank and have a status of "Not Processed". You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.
